headline: Whipped Shortbread Cookies
description: This whipped shortbread cookie recipe is so easy to make with butter, flour, and powdered sugar. Red and green maraschino cherries add a festive touch.
name: Whipped Shortbread Cookies
recipeIngredient: 5 red maraschino cherries, quartered, or as needed
5 green maraschino cherries, quartered, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Beat flour, butter, and confectioners' sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light and fluffy, about 10 minutes. Drop spoonfuls of dough 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Place a red or green maraschino cherry quarter onto the middle of each cookie.
Bake in the preheated oven until light brown on the bottom, 15 to 17 minutes. Cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: I made these without the cherries. Apricot jam worked well too! Mixing for the full 10 min is important, and its hard on the mixer at first, but softens and fluffs up as you go.
These are a bit with my mom's coworkers. I've even made a gf version. This year I'm going to make a chai inspired version.

I made these awesome cookies, easy to follow recipe. they turned out perfect. I made plain ones and then I made some with a little raspberry jam on them. they were ready in 13 minutes in my oven. this will be one of our family Christmas cookies from now on!!

They came out flat but that’s because this recipe didn’t call for cornstarch and I didn’t think of that in the moment haha. They taste great!! I cooked them on 350 F for 8-12mins. Make sure to whip every ingredient in after adding it for at least 2 mins. Add an extra 1/2-3/4 cup of flour if it’s not the right consistency. I had to add 3/4. Whip the last bit of flour in for 5-10 mins depending on how fluffy you want them. Add a tsp of cornstarch and a dash of vanilla for flavouring. Chill till its cookie dough consistency before cooking!! I had to chill it for 3 hours. After baking they were all too fragile so I threw them in the fridge overnight and now they’re durable enough that if my brother drops the bag a bunch, they don’t break easily.

I made these with high hopes because my husband loves shortbread cookies. Sadly, they were the worst cookies I have ever made. No flavor, bland as can be. I used butter (always do for cookies). I put the cherries on them, even some mini chocolate chips and nothing saved them. My husband took them out the chickens; an hour later they were still on the ground. I normally love anything I make from allrecipes but these missed the mark all the way around!
My daughter added peanut butter and put raspberry jam in their center!

What am I missing? These were a complete failure. I followed the recipe word for word. They baked nicely then completely fell apart and I couldn’t even remove from the tray. Did I mix them to much? Should there have been any eggs? I am completely dead over these
I’m sure I did something wrong but 20 minutes baking was way too long. They came out brown and had a crispy texture. Definitely not rich and buttery, melt-in-your-mouth.
Easy and really delicious!
Easy to make, tastes great! Will make again.
Seasonal favourite!
Absolutely delicious & easy to make. Sift the flour & icing sugar. Used dried cranberries.
Very easy to make and taste great

Super easy! 
Just added vanilla as well, set mixer to 10min came back spooned out with mini cream scoop, made 26. 
This was cooked by my 11year old.

made these without the cherries as I didn't have them so I just had classic shortbread cookies. didn't make any modifications and I didn't whip the butter but they still turned out amazing! i melted the butter beforehand. not sure how long i baked for as I just kept checking the oven after ~10 min, turned out to be golden brown on outside and soft/buttery on the inside.
it is melt in your heaven! made them twice and still loving it.

I followed the recommendations of beating the butter alone first for 5 minutes, then again with the sugar, and dividing the flour into 3 parts with 2 minutes beating after the first two, and ten minutes after the third. Decorated with dried cranberries ( a real treat on the other side of the world ~ China!). They are a Christmas gift worth giving! Excellent!!!

I actually did not do anything different to the recipe, but I found that my butter was not soft enough. I had mixed all of the ingredients together instead of mixing each separately, popped it in the microwave for 15 seconds, then with the mixer, mixed for about 5 minutes until I felt it looked fluffy but stiff enough for cookie dough. 
I then formed each cookie and put in the oven for 14 minutes.
They came out BEAUTIFULLY!!!!
First time making shortbread cookies, and they were not crumbly, dry, or super delicate. They were perfect!!
And MELT in your mouth delicious. Thank you for my must have recipe for any occasion:)
a great recipe, I have been making it for several years and it always goes over extremely well. very easy to make.
Our new favorite Christmas cookie. Easy to make and ohhh soo good.

These are really good! Especially with a stand mixer that you can set the timer and let go for 10 minutes. Definitely worth the extra beating time.

I made the recipe and probably won't make it again. Like others have said, they fell apart! I used butter too. I also added a two vanilla thinking this would flavor it nice and keep the dough together. Oh my goodness, they are delicious and would be great over a bowl of vanilla ice cream. As a cookie no I don't think so.
Don’t over whip them, they get crumby. But they do melt in your mouth for sure!

Wow, great recipe! The secret is to really whip it, whip it good! Pardon the Devo reference. The cookies came out light and "fluffy" and almost melted in my mouth. I am a chocoholic and while I know I would have thoroughly enjoyed these little gems with a maraschino cherry in the middle I opted for a nice chocolate ganache drizzle instead. They were well received be family and friends alike.
These are very delicate, melt in your mouth cookies! My friends raved about them. They are extremely tender and, therefore, not good for mailing.... no matter, you'll want to eat them all yourself!
Great shortbread cookie!

Delicious shortbread flavour. I did add 1/2 c flour and a tbsp of white sugar as well as chocolate chips. Will use this recipe over and over. I baked them at 350 for 15 minutes and this worked for my oven.

Nice recipe, and if you beat it properly it comes out beautifully. 15min too long, and my oven doesn't usually run hot. 13 on second batch was perfect. 
I'm trying to find my mom's recipe, and this isn't quite it. Hers was richer somehow, not quite sure what's missing. Won't make again as I'm on a cookie hunt, but very good :)
Whipped butter for 10 mins before adding flour and icing sugar. Baked @ 325 for 15 min. Very light and crumbly
Had to add some extra flower but overall really good.
This is my go to to recipe. Of course I whip them longer. And add flour 1/2 cup at a time. And whip each round for at leadt 3-4 minutes. I cant make enough of these. They are a fan favorite
no changes recipe was very good
I followed the recipe and they came out sandy and won't hold together. If that's what you're looking for, the flavor wasn't bad.
Love this recipe - make it every Christmas

This was a great recipe, but I did follow some other suggestions. Also, having used this recipe for years, I’ve customized it a bit:- You have to WHIP forever, but SO worth it. - I doubled the recipe and added an extra cup of flour. - I didn’t add all the ingredients together. I whipped the room temperature butter and 2tsp Mexican vanilla for about 7 minutes and then alternating flour / icing sugar while whipping constantly. I probably mixed for around 13-15 minutes total. I also added 1tsp corn starch- I formed them into walnut sized balls and then flattened slightly and sprinkled red & green sugar on top. - I baked at about 13 minutes on an insulated baking sheet
not totally inedible, but that's the best we can say about this recipe - flavor is flat, cooking time was way off (burned around the edges after 15 mins) and they spread out way too thin.

I wanted to like these. I really did. I made the recipe exactly as stated, including beating for the times listed. The cookies were SUPER soft so I put them in wax paper and made a roll to slice later. After chilling overnight, I sliced them and baked them. Yuck. They just tasted like flour and the texture was gross. Almost chalk-like. Not anything like what the other reviewers described in their glowing reviews. I tried baking a second batch adding some baking sugar on top. Didn't help. Bummer.
These are exceptional cookies. I add a tsp of vanilla too. Thank you.
These cookies were amazing and very simple to make. They came out so delicate and buttery. This one is a keeper. Thanks for the recipe.

Followed the recipe to a T. Been using this recipe for a few years now and it's a crowd pleaser! I make these cookies and give them away as presents--people actually ask when they are getting their tin of cookies from me! So good.

I followed some of the suggestions to beat the butter separate and beat for longer (I didn't do the full 5 minutes after each addition however) and it turned out great. 
I ended up using a piping bag and tip because the mixture was very sticky and soft. I cooled the cookies on the pan outside, (no fridge space left this time of year!) and while they didn't keep the full shape, they had a nice little swirl in the middle of them once baked. 
These were for sure, the favourite cookie of the ones I made. I'm going to save this recipe and add it to my repertoire for sure!
I made these twice and they turned out perfect !!! They are delicious.
I would make this again!
Excellent cookie melts in your mouth

I follow the recipe exactly and the cookies were melt in your mouth crumblies. The only changes I made to the original recipe , I whipped the butter to a near foamy state (maybe five to seven minutes, then I added everything else gradually and kept the mixer on high speed as I added. I have been doing this recipe for four years and end up selling more than the local stores sell. -Oh yes, I added a table spoon of home made vanilla after the butter & sugar are fully whipped.-

Easiest: toss in stand mixer, scrape down 2-3 times over 10mins, pretty hands off. For super fast cookies I use a spoon to drop them or I mostly go fancy and use a cookie press: nobody believes I make these at home, have been “accused” of buying them at the bakery and putting them in a Tupperware when I brought them to book club. I make them dozens of times a year, best cookie ever for Christmas cookie swap. Ever.

I tried making these three different ways to see what would get the best results. Like kathleen mentioned, I whipped the butter for about five minutes and then added icing sugar and let it whip for three minutes more, before adding the flour. I baked at 300 for 5-8 minutes as she suggested...it did not work for me. I ended up baking them for longer because they were definitely not cooked, and then they were crumbly. I also tried two batches at 350 for 15-20 minutes...this was ideal, but you need to press the spoonfuls down (haha). I used silver balls instead of maraschino cherries, and these were great! Held together, buttery...delicious!
Easy to make and tasted great.

Loved this recipe. First time making it. I did whip about 10 minutes longer than recipe called and I doubled the recipe. Shortbread was delicious but very fragile even if a little warm. Next time I will let them cool completely before removing from pan. Absolutely wonderful right out of the freezer as well. Will make again for sure .
my husband loved these

This was a wonderful recipe!!! They really do melt in your mouth!! A big thank you to some of the reviewers out there for your suggestions. I added some cornstarch, a little extra powdered sugar and a little extra vanilla extract. Also, per a suggestion, I made sure to whip the butter for 5 minutes first then whip the heck out of the whole mixture till it had a creamy texture. Thanks so much for posting this recipe and for the suggestions!!

Made without tweaking ingredients, but added some vanilla extract for flavour. Beat as much as I could stand to beat the ingredients, after each addition to get as much air in them as possible.
Baked at 300 degrees for close to 20 minutes each batch to dry them out nicely.
Love these cookies!!! I make them exactly as it says and they turn out perfect evert time! Light, fluffy and melt in your mouth!

I followed the recipe as written and the cookies turned out perfectly. The only thing I changed was i baked them for less time - I made a triple batch and after the first couple, I found they really only needed 8-10 minutes to bake.

Made these on December 20,2016 just as recipe shows only doubled the recipe, make sure you beat for at least 10 minutes and they definitely do come out 'melt in your mouth' delicious! Also I soften the whole lb. of Room temperature butter in microwave at power level 50 for about 1 minute, depending on how soft butter already is

Not too shabby. Butter turned out to be a bit too cold still so had to heat it on the stove with the flour etc and then add some more flour and sugar and I added a TB of vanilla. 350 for 12 mins, perfect
Followed recipe to the T, cookies turned out OK, did not like the taste. Hoping they taste better tomorrow. Was not a hit with this family.. Off to try another recipe..
They are very good even my happy husband enjoyed them and he does not usually eat shortbread

Cookies came out flat and almost burnt after 10 minutes. They tasted like flour even though I added vanilla before beating. Pretty disappointing with how much ingredients it used up.

I followed reviewer KATHLEEN'S review instructions. Though I increased my oven temp from 300 to 325 and baked them for 12 min. Just until the edges were toasted brown. I topped the cookies with mini chocolate chipits before baking. They are melt in your mouth AMAZING! So whip your butter for 5min then add powdered sugar and whip again for 5min. I also added about a tbsp. of vanilla powder cuz I like it. Then in increments of 1/2 c. at a time add flour whipping 2 min between ea. increment. Scrape the sides of the bowl down into the batter regularly as you whip. Then I whipped for another 5 min after all the flour was added. I really don't think you can OVER whip these cookies so don't worry about that. Now you could pipe the cookies onto a cookie sheet but I just dropped them by spoonful onto a PARCHMENT PAPER lined cookie sheet. I also DOUBLED the batch and it worked out just fine. They are really good. The taste of Christmas. Gosh there are so many tastes of Christmas aren't there? LOL! Merry Christmas bakers and chefs of allrecipes.com !

We tried it again the next day with granulated sugar and the cookie was more substantial, but still "melted" in the oven. We subbed peach preserves for the cherries, that was great!

I followed the recipe except for adding 1/2 tsp of vanilla. I beat the dough after each ingredient was added. The cookies were extremely light and fell apart in your hand, before getting to your mouth.

I followed this recipe to a T, except I added about 1/3 cup extra flour and they turned out perfect. This is my first time making short bread and they are exactly what I was looking for! I did NOT follow other reviewers recommendations on the whipping and mine turned out super fluffy and melt in your mouth. I simply whipped for 10 minutes in my kitchen aid mixer and every couple minutes scraped the sides of the bowl and cleaned out the beater a bit. This will be my go to recipe for short bread!

I made as recipe indicated and I couldn't even pick up the cookies as they literally almost disintegrated in my hands! Do NOT beat for 10 minutes - taste was very nice, but way too flaky!! Unfortunately I will need to make another batch as these just won't work for a baking tray - I guess I'll go back to my own whipped shortbread recipe!
Very yummy cookies :)
Every Christmas I make these with this recipe and it's always a huge hit. I skip the cherries instead doing a buttercream icing.

Followed the recipe to the exact directions on recipe. unfortunately I seemed like I was eating a mouthful of butter.
Crumbled before got off the cookie sheet. Also only baked for ten minutes and were browned. One or two minutes more it would have burnt. I keep a thermometer in my over to double check. Disappointed! Am surfing the internet from another recipe.

First time to make. It's easy and turned out very well. I also used the hand mixer.

I just tried the recipe and love it. I used my kitchen aid mixer for about 5 minutes on medium speed.

I made this and it was incredible! Totally melt in your mouth! I used half butter half margarine and a little extra icing sugar. Thanks William Anatooskin!

I followed one of the reviewers mixing times - whip butter 5 min, add sugar and whip another 5 min, add flour then whip for 10min. Result is most delicious, this is my new favourite shortbread recipe!

Despite what some reviewers have said, you can, in fact, overwhip these. I followed one reviewer who said to whip for 5 minutes after each ingredient and those cookies practically turned to liquid when they baked. I've never seen a cookie do what that batch did. I do, however, beat the butter for a solid 5 minutes alone, then add the remaining dry ingredients slowly. Beating time ends up a total of 10 minutes, as the original recipe states. These cookies melt in your mouth, and they are VERY DELICATE, but they taste amazing.

Huge huge hit every time I make these as they literally melt in your mouth :)
I had to change it up as my oookies fell flat too much butter for this recipe.

love this cookies

This recipe is now a keeper!
